intro: Stachyanthus devredii, commonly known as the red-stemmed stachyans, is a striking flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and as a garden plant in warm climates.
